solution_line_template: Katy's three {katy_bag_weight}-pound bags of flour weigh {katy_num_bags}*{katy_bag_weight}=<<{katy_num_bags}*{katy_bag_weight}={katy_total_flour_pounds}>>{katy_total_flour_pounds} pounds.

Wendi brought Twice as much flour as Katy, or {katy_total_flour_pounds}*{wendi_multiplier}=<<{katy_total_flour_pounds}*{wendi_multiplier}={wendi_total_flour_pounds}>>{wendi_total_flour_pounds} pounds of flour.

Carrie brought {carrie_less_than_wendi} pounds less flour than Wendi, or {wendi_total_flour_pounds}-{carrie_less_than_wendi}=<<{wendi_total_flour_pounds}-{carrie_less_than_wendi}={carrie_total_flour_pounds}>>{carrie_total_flour_pounds} pounds of flour.

Thus, Carrie brought {carrie_total_flour_pounds}-{katy_total_flour_pounds}=<<{carrie_total_flour_pounds}-{katy_total_flour_pounds}={difference_pounds}>>{difference_pounds} pounds of flour more than Katy.
In ounces, the {difference_pounds} pound difference is {difference_pounds}*{ounces_per_pound}=<<{difference_pounds}*{ounces_per_pound}={difference_ounces}>>{difference_ounces} ounces.
